website_summaries.verdict: Though its feature set is light, the Canon PowerShot A490 is a very good choice for anyone on a tight budget who still wants excellent photo quality.

customer_reviews.title: Loved this camera- used for 7 years now and still ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved this camera- used for 7 years now and still takes great pictures even in auto mode (compared to some more expensive models I tried). I am certainly looking for a replacement but I am finding it hard to select something just as compact and full of features to replace it. Everything seems to be too bulky (even in point and shoot format) for my taste these days.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen P

customer_reviews.title: Canon Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been a film photographer for 30+ years. The increased costs have forced this 75 year old man to look for a less expensive alternative. I won't bore you with the technical specs, that I don't understand. I do wish that the camera and memory card had been shipped together. It was tough having to wait for the needed memory card to arrive by 'snail mail' while all I could do was read the user's manual for the camera. Off hand, I will have a steep learning curve it seems. This camera has little resemblance to my 35mm SLRs or 4x5 view cameras. Hopefully this camera will make up for some of the lost enjoyment of photography.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for two weeks, and I'm almost completely satisfied. Good: Easy to use for basic point-and-shoot pictures and zooming Quick to turn on Picture quality is good Not so good: Several of our outdoor zoomed pictures had a noticable streak/lens flare if the camera was pointed in the same general direction as the sun. As with most digital cameras, the instructions are skimpy and the features are indicated by cryptic little icons. The screen seems fragile, although nothing has damaged it yet. Maybe not a problem. Overall, not perfect, but quite worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: jrbd

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is great for the price. However, make sure you buy a good protective bag for it or you will be sorry. It is not build to withstand falls. I do not beleieve there are that many cameras who are made to withstand falls. The zoom feature is great and I love the picture quality. It only takes about 20-30 mins to learn the camera and then you are off taking pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul F. Marrow

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Buy For A General Use Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Canon camera many months ago for a surprisingly low price. I used to be involved in photography & I had a top-of-the-line Canon camera that was great. I no longer do any photography, but I occasionally need a camera for pictures to e-mail to friends, that sort of thing. Since I loved my old Canon camera, I thought I'd buy this one. Heck, I just love this camera. I use it for general occasional use. It's easy to operate and it takes a decent picture.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: You don't get what you pay for ... you get more.
customer_reviews.text: For what I paid ( less than $60 ) this is really hard to beat ... I read some of the reviews and some of the authors need to be a little more realistic. It takes great photos , is light and travels well, simple timer, and is easy to use . I will grab this without hesitation in many situations where I do not want to lug my bigger Nikon around. No problems with it so far. The best pictures are the ones taken... if your leaving your camera at home because its too heavy or too " expensive " this is a great option...
customer_reviews.author: Mountains are Calling

customer_reviews.title: Great little point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a gift for my spouse who likes to take good but uncomplicated pictures. She loves it because it is small enough to fit into her purse where it is readily available. She also likes the quick readiness of the camera and its pretty ample zoom quality that enables her to get closeup or fairly distant shots very quickly. She does not miss shots that she did with her older camera. A good little point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Carl W. Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level camera!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera as a gift for my mother-in-law. She loves to take pictures but still uses the disposable cameras. This camera here is ideal for someone who has never used a digital camera before. My mother-in-law has had no problem adjusting to using this camera, and has stopped buying the disposable cameras. It has been very simple to use. The picture quality exceeds my expectations for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Holls

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera
customer_reviews.text: It has proven to be a good little camera, worthy of it's price. It has traveled well, takes a reasonably good picture for most uses and I would recommend it to family. Not like the Nikon I bought previously to this one that was a complete piece of #$%$. I had to send in for repair under warranty, got it back and it failed again within 6 months (same problem). Will stick with Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for an NDVI project
customer_reviews.text: Low cost NDVI camera. Easy to convert but I suspect the autofocus was semi functional before I purchased it. Inexpensive and fairly priced as other sellers have taken advantage of people looking to DIY their own NDVI solution. No complaints about the seller.
customer_reviews.author: LTC WLOO, IL

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This camera replaced a ten year old Fuji digital camera and is significantly smaller and lighter. The weight of the camera can give the impression of flimsiness but really the materials appear appropriate for the purpose. Picture quality is more than adequate for my purposes, even in poor light when it easily outperforms my old camera.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Love Canon, this model is TOTAL LETDOWN.
customer_reviews.text: Broke my Canon Powershot on vacation, THIS replaced it. Description sounded the same, but NOT the same at all. Less options, overheats then freezes. Currently stuck half open/half closed...don't know why. LOVED all my other Powershot cameras, THIS was a total letdown.
customer_reviews.author: K Grebitus

customer_reviews.title: OK Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the camera I was expecting. Nothing too fancy, bulky or pricey. I bought this for the day to day, when hanging out with friends, for quick shots, etc. Picture quality is ok, though I would not use this to record a video, the quality is horrible. Only for pics. I like the design and that is not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports recommended this camera. I got it for $80. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. CR compared it to a $350 camera and said that this camera's pictures were just as good. This is a great buy for someone who is looking for a simple camera to take clear pictures.
customer_reviews.author: VangieGirl

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot A490
customer_reviews.text: I was able to take good pictures right out of the box. They are clear. The camera goes from light to dark conditions very well for great pictures in any light. I am very happy with it and would recommend it to anyone who wants a small digital camera that is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Streeter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth retail value
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera when Amazon had it for $50. For $50, it got the job done. Overall, it feels very cheaply built, and the pictures are not that great quality. Even though it has the MP's, it's the sensor that counts, and that's what I feel is lacking. The batteries were also a pain. I would rather have a rechargeable battery that I can slide into an AC wall charger than have to worry about buying batteries all the time. With active use, the camera would like 1.5-2 weeks on a set of batteries. TL;DR - for $100, just spend a little more and get a better camera
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera at a good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as an extra - very easy to use and the pictures are great. I like the fact that it runs on batteries. My other camera has to have the battery charged. It ran out the other day at the park. Carrying a couple of batteries is easy. Would definitely recommend it for standard pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L. Ticehurst

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good quality. It broke after only 3 months and the picture quality was terrible and hard to install. I did buy a better Cannon and spent a little more money on it. I am glad I upgraded and didn't go cheap. Guess you get what you pay for. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Mix-in-it

customer_reviews.title: Good as a 2nd camera for mobile purposes
customer_reviews.text: This camera is small and neat. Although it's a 10MP it doesn't shoot that clearly. The flash has to charge which is a bit frustrating since it means long waits between shots. Convenient to carrry around because of it's size, so it's great as a 2nd (in case of emergency) camera.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Within 4 months it won't keep the date
customer_reviews.text: Got a great price on the camera, but within 4 months, it won't keep the date correctly; constantly needs to be reset & then doesn't count it correctly when it does hold for a day. Make mananging photos a huge hassle. Eats thru the AA's.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Leshinsky

customer_reviews.title: good beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my 12 year old granddaughter, who is computer savy, she loves it and figured it out withen an hour. great price and gift. Make sure you get a larger memory card for it so it holds more pictures and runs faster.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnie Loo

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to Operate
customer_reviews.text: We gave this camera to our 5 year old grandson since we thought the "toy" camera made for his age was too immature for his abilities. We were right to give him this one. He has taken some fantastic pictures and he is able to use it with ease. Batteries needed to be replaced rather soon, but all in all, it is a great little camera for the price. If a 5 year old can use it, anyone can.
customer_reviews.author: Mary in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, I wanted a camera that took regular batteries. Very fast shipping from seller - well packaged!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: PIX
customer_reviews.text: GOT THIS NOT KNOWING HOW IT WOULD DO. I HAVE BEEN USING CAMERA ON ALL OUR OCCASIONS, AND CRUISES. TAKES FANTASTIC PICTURES, AND HAS FEATURES OF OLD TIME FAVORITES TO SELECT.
customer_reviews.author: C Buehler

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot A490
customer_reviews.text: So far, we're happy with this camera. It does not come with a card, so be prepared for that. It is small and has a handy little carrying case; more lightweight than our previous Canons. And the pictures have been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Boos

customer_reviews.title: Canon A490
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied. Bought as pocket camera which could be easily carried at all times. Need to have fastest memory card to get satisfactory performance. Wish it had more optical zoom like my CANON SX110, but the smaller size and lighter weight make the CANON A490 an acceptable substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Papa

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value!
customer_reviews.text: Love the Canon Powershot line! Designed well with quality and features. Additionally, this camera was offered on sale and I scored a great deal, including a free Lowepro case for it. Can't beat dealing with Amazon.com as well! THANKS
customer_reviews.author: klarcr

customer_reviews.title: We use this camera all the time, plug it ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this camera all the time, plug it into your computer via USB and get your photos on your laptop or PC. We have not issues with this little camera.
customer_reviews.author: smartAmazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 73 YO mother and it is awesome. Easy and non complicated to operate. uses 2 AA batteries so nothing to worry about. I recommend this camera for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: xxooss

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this camera YEARS ago and it still works! Great camera for the price! I now have a newer model.
customer_reviews.author: wallybowser

customer_reviews.title: Takes Great pics and has other good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a friend. Takes Great pics and has other good features
customer_reviews.author: Jojo D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! I bought this camera Aug. 19, 2010 and it worked great for nearly a year then it had some problems, it still worked but I would have trouble turning it on, so I sent it back and got a new one free! The new one has been working great and I would certianly suggest this as a great camera to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Kesterke

customer_reviews.title: Great starter cam....
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes some of the most awesome outdoor pics I have ever seen. Yes it takes 2 aa batteries .
customer_reviews.author: rammer

customer_reviews.title: Very slow in between clicks Shutter speed outdated Annoying Antiquated camera
customer_reviews.text: Very slow in between clicks Shutter speed outdated Annoying Antiquated camera
customer_reviews.author: D. Argiroff

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera all of the time. It is compact and produces great photos, it is easy to upload photos onto my computer. I highly recommend it to anyone. It travels well also because of its size.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for 40 dollars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for 40 dollars cant complain my mom needed a new camera she lost so i bought her a new one but worked awesome for everyday use
customer_reviews.author: AvgJoe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this camera. It was cute, tiny, and took amazing pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Gloomyblue

customer_reviews.title: need steady hand
customer_reviews.text: It is great camera for the price. Easy to use, captures very nice pictures outdoor. Low light pictures are little bit grainy and you need to hold camera steady. Since it is light weight camera it is difficult to hold it steady. Some time pictures are very good, bright and sharp (compared to DSLR result) but thats based on your luck. I still recommend this if budget is main concern
customer_reviews.author: Gadget fan

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap looking
customer_reviews.text: Camera is alright, i expected more from a Canon camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Oberg

customer_reviews.title: Good product for money
customer_reviews.text: It is acceptable quality camera but still not as good as other canon compact range cameras But not bad for a good cheap price
customer_reviews.author: UJJVAL BHAGAT

customer_reviews.title: It it what it is...
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is, a Canon low end camera that is as simple to use as it gets. Perfect for the novice and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Szeliga

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as a gift and my daughter loved it. It was exactly as described and will be used alot.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and the value was incredible :) :) :) Picture quality was good too. Reason for four stars is not a rechargable battery which kinda sucks. But otherwise....great point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: ChopShop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This camera is among the best I've owned, especially considering the price. The pictures are bright and clear and the camera is easy to use. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: lorlive

customer_reviews.title: "used" camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived with secure packaging and very timely. Batteries included were no good out of shelf life I think. The camera was listed as "used" meaning taken out of original package but everything was in order. I like the camera size, pictures are wonderful and instructions clear since this is my first digital camera and I am learning how to use it to the best advantage.
customer_reviews.author: J. England

customer_reviews.title: but I was happy to find this
customer_reviews.text: a few surface scratches, but I was happy to find this. I needed an exact replica of what I previously had to ensure the person I bought it for would know how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Cherish Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not a good camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my daughter to take to camp. I had purchased less expensive one ($50 +/-), but the picture quality was terrible. The camera is well built and the photos are fantastic. FOLLOW-UP: a little over a year later the view finder broke. I like Cannon products but stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Diefenthaler

customer_reviews.title: vacation shots
customer_reviews.text: I bought the camera for a trip to the Grand Canyon. Camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. The only complaint you cannot see the picture prior to snapping the shot on a sunny day, was afraid shots would turn out bad but after downloading pitures they all turned out great. Would prefer an eye piece to center shots.
customer_reviews.author: C. George

customer_reviews.title: Canon A490 a Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift item for a family member who wanted a compact camera that took quality pictures. The price is also a plus. We are very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Digital Power
customer_reviews.text: I am liking my new camera, the PowerShot A490 10.0 MP Digital with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD. The image window is much clearer and the pictures appear to be very good. I am still getting used to it. I need to spend more time using it. EBB
customer_reviews.author: EBB

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: it was great ad the time until the battery door broke.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiga37484

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter Digital Camera for Kids or Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive plastic encases the camera but the picture quality makes up for it. No special battery charger is needed. The camera utilizes common AA batteries. This camera is intuitive and simple to use. I bought it for my 80-year old mother as a starter camera. Would be a good camera for kids, too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shoaf

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for $50
customer_reviews.text: Every thing is fine, for a point and shoot cam. Photo quality is excellent. Good light sensitivity (can take indoor pics with confident). The only thing that cause little annoyance is the responsiveness. You have to wait 2-3s, after your click, for the picture to save in memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Duy Dang

customer_reviews.title: Never underestimate this camera's performance by its low price.
customer_reviews.text: The irony in the camera's world is the cheaper the camera, the better the picture quality. This is true at least in my case. For years I've owned the following cameras in the order of their prices: Canon A490 ($95) (5 stars) Canon Xsi ($612) (5 stars) Canon T2i ($849) (4 stars) Nikon D70 ($1,000) (4 stars) Canon 50D ($1,110) (3 stars) Unfortunately, the order of the picture quality is just the opposite---Canon A490 being the best (5-star) and Canon 50D being the worst. You can never complain anything about A490. Too bad I can't post here stunningly beautiful pictures taken with my A490 that I recently purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ma

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: This camera was so easy to set up and start taking pictures. Takes wonderful pictures. I am compelely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a nice little camera. My son-in-law whose hobby is photography was really impressed with the quality of the pictures. I wish the battery life was a little longer but I've learned to carry a spare . . . or two!
customer_reviews.author: Nana Conni

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang for your buck......
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! I take it with me everywhere, so I am able to capture the memories :) Pictures come out quite nice & it's a good size screen too. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mazgirl62

customer_reviews.title: great camera at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the camera very much yet so I'm still learning. I just wanted something to take pictures,no bells and whistles. Consumer's Report recommended this model so I'm giving it a try. Seller packaged camera very well.
customer_reviews.author: DianeLyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy for the parents
customer_reviews.text: I gave this camera to my parents as a present and despite their typical aggravation with unfamiliar technology, this camera has been a hit so far and they seem to be learning how to use it well.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot A490
customer_reviews.text: I've only my camera for weeks but the little time that I ve had it, it appears to be wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Perky

customer_reviews.title: A very good camera
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a very good product. It's very light and easy to use, I recomend it for home photos.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: i needed a cheap camera and after doing research on amazon i found this and really like it. it is easy to use and takes good pics. i have had a few fuzzy ones but for the price i could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine camera for a teenage girl. We purchased this as a gift for our daughters birthday and it has held up very well to the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: buzzer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with camera.
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied with purchase of this Canon camera. It's very basic, easy to use, small & light weight, and the picture quality is better than average. I was looking for something like this so I didn't always have to carry around my bigger 35mm camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Trevino

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This company has great customer service. We are so impressed with how they have handled our order! We would purchase from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: rhird

customer_reviews.title: NEEDS A MEMORY CARD
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I may be the only ignorant buyer here but why or why would this camera not come with a "required" item. Sure, they gave me two double A batteries because I really need them but hey, don't try to take a picture unless you purchased a memory card which is sold separately. How about you include the memory card and leave out the batteries? I can always find two double A batteries around the house. I'm rating this product three stars just in case I really am the only ignorant buyer here!
customer_reviews.author: C. Regan

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot Camera A490
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. The camera did NOT come with a memory card nor did it have the hand strap or a battery. I had hoped that the Canon PowerShot A490 camera would come ready to use or at least need a battery. For a month now, the camera has been idle because I have not had the time to shop for a memory card and hand strap. Since there was no memory card and no battery, I cannot evaluate the performance of the camera. This was a disappointing purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ajax369

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 days
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday purchase for my 8 year old son. The lens retraction stopped working within 2 days. I wouldn't recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: flatmr

customer_reviews.title: Where's the Memory???
customer_reviews.text: Nice to hold, easy setup, very readable user manual, but no memory??? Even though I did order a memory card at the same time, Amazon doesn't stock it, so the memory is shipped by another party, non-expedited and at additional expense, totally negating the $.90 savings on the camera. a memory card of some capacity should be included with camera purchase so it can be used right out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Nobles

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot A490 10.0 MP Digital Camera with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD
product_meta.description: Camera in good working condition, comes with digital av output cord and camera. New batteries included
feature_bullets: 10.0 megapixels and 3.3x optical zoom make picture taking a snap
Smart AUTO intelligently selects from 13 predefined shooting situations; Low Light mode enables great shots in dim lighting
AA battery power enables you to easily power up on the go
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars127 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
